Title: Kunderettet udvikler til Defence
Description: Du bliver ansvarlig for at hjælpe vores kunder med at implementere vores standardsoftwareløsninger, SitaWare og IRIS, i deres tekniske infrastruktur og deres arbejdsgange. Hos kunderne er du god til at lytte og tilpasse dig kundens ønsker, så den samlede løsning skaber mest mulig værdi. Arbejdet foregår i tværfaglige teams med system engineers, solution engineers, arkitekter, testere og projektledere, som sammen planlægger og gennemfører implementeringen af vores systemer hos kunderne. Omfanget af opgaverne spænder fra enkeltstående hjælp til en enkelt del af implementeringen til det fulde ansvar for en udrulning. Du vil blive involveret i aktiviteter såsom installation, konfiguration, integrationstests, integration af tredjepartskomponenter, træning og softwareudvikling.
HTML_Text:
Lignende jobannoncer Job hos Systematic A/S (2) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2015-11-27 15:32:05. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2015-11-27 15:32:05. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Kunderettet udvikler til Defence Brænder du for at rejse ud til vores Defence-kunder i hele verden og opsætte og konfigurere vores softwareprodukter? Jobbet Du bliver ansvarlig for at hjælpe vores kunder med at implementere vores standardsoftwareløsninger, SitaWare og IRIS, i deres tekniske infrastruktur og deres arbejdsgange. Hos kunderne er du god til at lytte og tilpasse dig kundens ønsker, så den samlede løsning skaber mest mulig værdi. Arbejdet foregår i tværfaglige teams med system engineers, solution engineers, arkitekter, testere og projektledere, som sammen planlægger og gennemfører implementeringen af vores systemer hos kunderne. Omfanget af opgaverne spænder fra enkeltstående hjælp til en enkelt del af implementeringen til det fulde ansvar for en udrulning. Du vil blive involveret i aktiviteter såsom installation, konfiguration, integrationstests, integration af tredjepartskomponenter, træning og softwareudvikling. I perioder vil du indgå i vores softwareudviklingsteam, som løbende vedligeholder og videreudvikler vores standardsoftware med udgangspunkt i feedback fra kunderne. Du skal søge dette job, hvis du: drømmer om at rejse cirka 70-80 dage om året - ofte med kort varsel er bedst i et job, hvor du har både hardware og software mellem fingrene og formår at optimere kundernes udbytte af vores løsninger vil have en udfordrende hverdag, hvor tæt samarbejde med kunderne er i højsædet, og det er afgørende at skabe gode relationer og tillid trives godt med forskelligartede opgaver i et dynamisk miljø som drives af kundens prioriteter Dine kompetencer og din personlighed Du har en teoretisk baggrund som datalog, ingeniør eller lignende, og du er passioneret omkring samspillet mellem hardware og software. Du har erfaring med udrulning af softwareløsninger og samarbejde med kunder samt erfaring med nogle af følgende: Primært MS Windows teknologier og gerne Unix teknologier ITIL, MCSE eller lignende certificering Java EE og/eller .NET (C#), Groovy, Scala - her vil især erfaring med Java være en fordel HTML, CSS, JavaScript (AngularJS, JQuery), XML, XSD, XSLT SOAP, REST, HTTP, SSL/TLS, TCP/IP jPA, SQL (MSSQL, MySQL, Oracle, Postgres) Continuous integration og deployment, scripting Gerne militærerfaring eller domænekendskab Networks teknologi Du er en robust person, som altid sætter barren højt, og du har en villighed og evne til kontinuerligt at udvikle dig. Du er en stærk kommunikatør med et stort drive. Med din strukturerede tilgang leverer du resultater, der er med til at skabe fremtidens softwareløsninger og sætte dem i spil hos vores kunder. Endeligt taler og skriver du flydende dansk og mestrer engelsk på højt niveau. Systematic tilbyder Vores it-løsninger gør det enklere for brugerne at træffe kritiske beslutninger. Inden for forsvaret og i sundhedsvæsnet gælder det ofte beslutninger, som kan handle om liv eller død. I både den private og den offentlige sektor skal vores løsninger håndtere store mængder data, som for eksempel på biblioteksområdet med mere end 50 mio. udlån årligt. For at fortsætte udviklingen af løsninger, der har kundernes tillid, udfordrer vi derfor løbende hinanden, vores arbejdsprocesser og teknologier. Vi har en offensiv uddannelsespolitik med definerede karriereveje og interne proaktive Knowledge Networks. Vi er fokuseret på hele tiden at gøre alting bedre. Vores unikke kombination af de stærke principper fra CMMI og de bedste aspekter af Lean og Scrum gør os i stand til at udvikle pålidelige løsninger af høj kvalitet til vores kunder og levere til aftalt tid og pris. Vi arbejder i teams, og mange af vores teams inkluderer fuldt integrerede sourcede teammedlemmer. Vi prioriterer en fornuftig balance mellem arbejdsliv og privatliv, og vores agile tilgang giver dig god mulighed for langt hen ad vejen selv at planlægge dine arbejdsopgaver og arbejdstid. Vi vægter desuden det sociale sammenhold på arbejdspladsen og har en meget aktiv personaleforening. Da vi også arbejder på sikkerhedsklassificerede projekter, skal alle medarbejdere i Systematic sikkerhedsgodkendes. Læs mere på http://systematic.com/clearance . Spørgsmål og ansøgningsprocedure Hvis du har spørgsmål, så ring gerne til Senior Project Manager Gauri Varma Heise på + 45 89 43 20 00. Ansøgningsfrist: Vi indkalder til samtaler løbende. Arbejdssted: Aarhus Starttidspunkt: Januar eller efter aftale Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig. Systematic A/S udvikler software og systemløsninger til kunder inden for den offentlige sektor, sundhedssektoren, biblioteks- og læringssektoren, forsvaret, politiet, finanssektoren og serviceerhverv. Fælles for disse kunder er et behov for at kunne integrere, sammenstille og analysere store mængder komplekse data samt skabe et overblik, som muliggør kvalificeret beslutningstagning – ofte i kritiske situationer.
Systematic blev grundlagt i 1985 og er i dag Danmarks største privatejede software- og systemintegrator med store, internationale koncerner som partnere. Virksomheden har omkring 475 medarbejdere, og med hovedsæde i Aarhus og afdelinger i København, Australien, Finland, Forenede Arabiske Emirater, Frankrig, Singapore, Storbritannien, Sverige, Tyskland og USA servicerer vi kunder i 47 lande.

Title: ECM-coordinator and IT Super User
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job hos FOSS (17) Job i Nordsjælland kategoriseret i Økonomi- og virksomhedssystemer (15) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-24 03:14:26. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-24 03:14:26. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område ECM-coordinator and IT Super User FOSS - Hillerød Denne jobpostering er ikke længere tilgængelig på IT-Jobbank. Søg efter lignende job: FOSS job Do you see yourself following up and making sure everybody is doing what they should to get the ball rolling in a complex cross-functional process? Would you find it motivating to help others utilise the full potential of our SAP ERP and project IT systems? For our Project Management Office (PMO) we are looking for a combined Engineering Change Management (ECM) Coordinator and SAP Super User. We are placed in the heart of our R&D department and are the administrative backbone of the development projects that innovate and develop world leading instruments from concept until release. We are building a new team for the Project Management Office (PMO) to help FOSS become first and best. And we hope you can help us deliver projects successfully by making sure we are on top of our projects. The job In the role as ECM Coordinator you will be responsible for facilitating our ECM process for releasing new products into our production processes. You will work with our project managers to plan and facilitate the ECM process for each project and follow up with the people involved to make sure that the process runs effectively. In this role you will have significant influence on the success of our projects and their ability to meet key deadlines. As our SAP/Project IT Super User you will assist our project managers in using our IT systems in a productive way. You will train the project managers in the use of standard functionality, help them with more complex tasks and work with our finance and IT departments in developing new processes and features. The job will include training in the use of SAP, our Project IT system and development of reports and templates. Furthermore you will handle administrative tasks related to our IT systems. In addition you will be responsible for the implementation of a new generation of our project management- and reporting IT system during 2016. The candidate The preferred candidate holds a Bachelors degree or potentially a Masters degree. You are an adept user of the SAP ERP system and have a well rounded experience with IT. It will be an advantage if you have experience with Engineering Change Management processes or otherwise have participated in New Product Introduction (NPI) in a production environment. It will also be an advantage if you are familiar with working in a project organisation. We would also welcome it if you have experience with optimisation of administrative processes. It is a requirement to have a Danish work permit and to speak Danish fluently to apply for the job. We offer We offer a challenging job in an international and innovative company that is a world leader in its field. You will be a part of the new team for the PMO, where you will have the opportunity to make a difference and help us deliver successful projects. Application Send your application using the link below. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Program Manager, Product Innovation, Morten Novak Bro at mobn@foss.dk . Deadline is 22 January, but we encourage you to apply as early as possible, as we review applications on an ongoing basis. Title: Junoir Informationssikkerhedskonsulent
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job hos Grønlands Selvstyre (12) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-24 03:13:20. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-24 03:13:20. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Naalakkersuisut Inatsisartut Lovgivning Høringer Kundgørelser Job Publikationer Facebook Greenlandic (Greenland) Danish English Naalakkersuisut / Naalakkersuisut / Job / Ledige stillinger / Junoir Informationssikkerhedskonsulent Junoir Informationssikkerhedskonsulent Frist: 29.01.2016 Vi søger en selvstændig, ansvarsfuld og engageret kollega, som vil være med til at udvikle Grønlands Selvstyrets drifts- og sikkerhedsprocesser. Du skal på sigt varetage en række forskelligartede opgaver, heriblandt: -  At sikre implementering af Grønlands Selvstyrets overordnede IT sikkerhedspolitik -  At fortsætte udarbejdelse/vedligeholdelse af informationssikkerhedspolitikker -  At udvikle en national informationssikkerhedsstrategi -  At arbejde med IT beredskabsplanlægning -  At arbejde med revisioner, in- såvel som eksterne -  At varetage sikkerhedsdrift i.f.t. sikkerhedsincidents- og trusler samt sikkerhedsgodkendelser -  At sikre og forbedre den løbende ledelsesmæssige behandling. Den løbende forbedring af ledelsesbehandlingen indbefatter afklaringer af problemstillinger med enhedschefer samt den øverste ledelse. Vi vil sikre din uddannelse til Informationssikkerhedskonsulent, men du har en akademisk baggrund med dig. Derudover er du/har du og vil du blive uddannet i: - Uddannelse til at opnå faglig viden inden for informationssikkerhed, herunder certificering i ISO 27001 -  Opnå relevante certificeringer inden for Informationssikkerhedsprocesser og ITIL -  En god analytisk sans i forhold til fortsat udvikling i sit opgavefelt i en travl hverdag -  Opsøgende og løsningsorienteret i forhold til opgaveløsningen -  Kan varetage sine opgaver med stor grad af selvstændighed og er beslutningsdygtig samt dygtig til at kommunikere Og endelig forventes du: -  At varetage en bredere, tværgående og faglig koordinerende funktion – gerne med projektledelseserfaring i forhold til processer -  At betragte dokumentation og strukturerede beskrevne arbejdsgange som grundlæggende discipliner i det daglige drifts- og sikkerhedsarbejde Informationssikkerhed er en specialistfunktion som i tæt samarbejde med bl.a. IT driftschefen skaber rammer for leverandører og Grønlands Selvstyre, så informationssikkerheden kan leve op til det offentliges øgede krav til sikkerhed. Herudover er der fokus på et tættere samarbejde på tværs af organisationer og virksomheder i Grønland, og facilitering af dette arbejde, er ligeledes en del af jobindholdet, derfor vil det være optimalt hvis du har erfaring med tværsektorielt samarbejde. Løn- og ansættelsesvilkår Efter en konkret vurdering er der mulighed for at opnå ansættelse som specialkonsulent for den rette ansøger. Det er en forudsætning for din ansættelse, at du kan opnå en sikkerhedsgodkendelse på niveau hemmelig. Yderligere oplysninger Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen er du velkommen til at kontakte IT driftschef Tony Ditlevsdal på telefon +299 55 58 12 eller mail todi@nanoq.gl . Ansøgning Din ansøgning med CV, eksamenspapirer og eventuelle bilag sendes via  senest 29. januar 2016 Digitaliseringsstyrelsen opfordrer alle interesserede uanset alder, køn, religion eller etnisk tilhørsforhold til at søge stillingen. Vi forventer at holde samtaler i uge 06 I Digitaliseringsstyrelsen arbejder vi bl.a. med at drive en effektiv it-understøttelse og sikre en høj og ensartet it-service til alle enheder i Grønlands Selvstyre. Der arbejdes efter en flerleverandør outsourcing strategi. Digitaliseringsstyrelsen har endvidere ansvar for digitalisering af den offentlige sektor, som beskrevet i Naalakkersuisut Digitaliseringsstrategi ”Digitalisering som drivkraft”, samt udvikling af standarder, metoder og modeller til brug i arbejdet. Tilbage til stillingsoversigten Søg stillingen Ansat i Grønlands Selvstyre Søger du udfordringer og har lyst til at præge hverdagen gennem dit arbejdsliv og være med til at forme fremtiden, så er et job hos Grønlands Selvstyre noget for dig. Vi forventer stor ansvarlighed og vægter faglige kvalifikationer, en sund analytisk tilgang til tingene samt omstillingsparathed højt hos medarbejderne. Herudover er din evne til at strukturere hverdagen og bevare overblikket vigtig. Grønlands Selvstyre består af en Centraladministration, med mere end 650 ansatte fordelt på flere departementer, samt en lang række decentrale enheder. Tilsammen er vi mere end 2500 mennesker tilknyttet Grønlands Selvstyre. Centraladministrationens opgave er, at sikre Naalakkersuisut (regeringen) et solidt politisk beslutningsgrundlag, samt at føre de politiske beslutninger ud i livet. Du kan læse mere om Grønlands Selvstyre på www.naalakkersuisut.gl/job Naalakkersuisut Naalakkersuisut Medlemmer af Naalakkersuisut Departementer Koalitionsaftale Nyheder Kalender Grønlands Repræsentation i København Grønlands Repræsentation i Bruxelles Grønlands Repræsentation i Washington, D.C. Møder for Naalakkersuisut International indsats Taler Selvstyre Flagdage Job Ledige stillinger Information til jobsøgere Elev i Grønlands Selvstyre Uopfordrede ansøgninger Overenskomster og aftaler Kontakt Sitemap Sullissivik.gl Abonnement Intranet Namminersorlutik Oqartussat Imaneq 4, Postboks 1015 3900 Nuuk Telefon: (+299) 34 50 00 E-mail: info@nanoq.gl GLN numre

Title: Solution Architect - Cloud
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-25 04:05:18. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-25 04:05:18. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Solution Architect - Cloud Microsoft - København Cloud Computing is the next step toward ubiquitous and pervasive computing. Azure is Microsoft’s world-class cloud computing platform used to build, host, and scale applications and is one of the major strategic initiatives in Microsoft’s Cloud First Mobile First strategy. Azure is an open platform enabling hosting of both Windows and Linux applications and supports numerous languages such as .NET, Java, Node.js, and PHP. Come join the Azure team in the Enterprise Partner Group (EPG) as a Solution Architect –Cloud and be front and center in our customer’s transformation to cloud-based architectures while at the same time playing an influential role in transforming Microsoft to a Cloud First Mobile First company. In this role, you will be driving high priority customer initiatives on Azure in collaboration with customers and the Microsoft field. The Solution Architect- Cloud is a technical, customer facing role that will be accountable for the end-to-end customer cloud deployment experience. You will own the Azure technical customer engagement including: architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or Proofs of Concept (POCs). The ideal candidate will have experience in customer facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture and application design discussions with senior customer executives to drive cloud deployment. In this role, you will be responsible for the following: Drive the deployment of the customers’ workloads into Azure and increase their consumption of the platform by: Providing deployment guidance, supporting on the development of the customers’ cloud adoption model, providing appropriate recommendations to overcome blockers (i.e. Networking, Identity, Security, Compliance, etc.). Establish deep relationships with key ITDMs, who have the power to drive long-term cloud adoption within their company. Identify, validate and grow opportunities to accelerate consumption in high potential customer accounts, in partnership with the sales team, by driving solution architecture for pre-defined scenarios, for both infrastructure and applications. Build a Proof of Concept or a prototype, only if required. Enable the customer to envision their environment and services in Azure, while leveraging the greater Microsoft and partner resources (internal teams and partners). Accelerate consumption in high potential customer accounts by providing deep technical expertise and support in one out of the following four areas of specialization: 1. Datacenter Transformation (e.g., VM Deployments, Networking, ExpressRoute, HPC) 2. Custom Applications (e.g., Websites, PaaS Deployments, Mobile Services, IOT) 3. Media Services 4. Security, Compliance and Privacy (e.g., Identity, Governance, RBAC) Lead deployment of projects, creation of IP, and training of sellers and partners in your area of specialization Keep up to date with market trends and competitive insights. Coach other technical sellers to become certified in required Azure technical certifications. Aspire for technical excellence to embrace the new and innovate the how. Continuous improve technology skills of the Tech Sales deep on core and broad on adjacent solutions by leveraging corporate and local programs (e.g. TR, Community connects, etc.). Enable and leverage a strong tech community cross workloads, across EPG as well as together with Partner (P-Seller). Key Qualifications: Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers, and emerging computing trends Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior executives and growing cloud consumption share in large or highly strategic accounts Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through Problem-solving mentality leveraging internal and/or external resources, where and when needed, to do what’s right for the customer and for the organization (i.e. think through workarounds, evaluate risk of various deployment options, etc.) Exceptional verbal and written communication Ability to connect technology with measurable business value Demonstrated technical thought leadership in customer facing situations Demonstrated ability to deploy workloads on public cloud Requirements: 5+ years of success in consultative/complex technical sales and deployment projects (where necessary, managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projects 5+ years of architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications (i.e. having an architectural sense for ensuring availability, reliability, etc.) 2+ years of experience in “migrating” on premise workloads to the cloud Deep technical experience in one or more of the following areas: Software design or development Application Design Systems Operations / Management Database architecture Virtualization IP Networking Storage IT Security Linux Working knowledge with AGILE development, SCRUM and Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) with one or more of the following programming languages: .NET C++ Java JSON PHP Perl Python Ruby on Rails Pig/Hive Oversight experience on major transformation projects and successful transitions to implementation support teams Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences Technical BS degree, Computer Science or Math background highly desired, MBA optional Prior work experience in a Consulting/Architecture position within a software and/or services company AZ16 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity. All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of color, race, nationality, ethnic origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. 1 dag siden - gem job » Vis eller anvend på job Send en e-mail til en ven med dette job Solution Architect Job i København Job på Microsoft i København Om denne virksomhed Microsoft Microsoft Corporation develops, manufactures, licenses and supports a range of software products for computing devices. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Product Change Manager Cum & Candy Nordics Mondelez International - Brøndby Thousands of packets and bags of our yummy products – think Stimorol, V6 go flying off shelves all over the Nordics, every day. It takes a team of talented people who know Supply Chain inside out and back to front to get these delicious products out to our customers. To be able to convert good ideas into delicious products in the shelves, we need excellent cross-functional teamwork. It is through planning, communication and coordination across the whole supply chain, that we can turn our ideas into success stories. As a Product Change Manager (PCM), you play an important role in making this happen. As our PCM for Gum & Candy you will lead product related projects within your category; all from implementing a small quality improvement to the launching of a whole new product. You will work closely with colleagues across functions and geography and with external business partners to ensure that we deliver quality in a time-and cost efficient manner. You will do this by: Making sure you involve the right people in the projects and communicating within the organization Making risk assessment of your projects Setting up the projects’ timelines and leading project meetings Managing the formal documentation and processes of the projects Influencing business decisions through your perspectives Enabling best practice sharing by ensuring all projects are properly closed and key learning’s are documented Qualifications You might be the person we’re looking for if you: Have a University degree and a great interest in Supply Chain Have excellent project management skills Have good communication and interpersonal skills Have a proven track of delivering results in your previous positions Find motivation in delivering results together with and through others Are structured and good at planning, informing and delegating Have the capacity to keep track of details without losing sight of the big picture Are fluent in English. Ideally, you have knowledge of one Scandinavian language. Primary Location
:

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-25 04:06:31. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-25 04:06:31. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Senior Software Developer Monsenso - København Senior Software Developer Innovative and ambitious start-up company developing mHealth solution seeks equally innovative software developer. MONSENSO is a passionate team dedicated to designing innovative personal health that helps people, care providers, and societies overcome the burden of illness. We are looking for an ambitious Senior Software Developer, to assist in the development of the Monsenso mHealth platform. As a software developer, you will be a part of the entire lifecycle of the product – from discussing specifications with and patients to quality assurance and deployment. You will be a part of a small team of software developers, therefore, we are looking for with an academic background in software engineering with experience as a software developer, engineer or architect. You should have experience applying agile software development processes as well as quality assurance methodology and technology. Key responsibilities As a Senior Software Developer, you will be a part the technical implementation of all our solutions, which includes work within areas of: Requirement specification Software architecture and design System architecture and security Front- and backend web development Mobile development Data collection, management, pre-processing, and analysis Quality assurance Documentation and compliance We work with a broad range of languages, frameworks and technologies, including CSS, C#, Typescript, Java, Objective-C, Swift, NancyFx, Angularjs, nodejs, NoSQL, etc. You will be a part of a team of 8 people, and, therefore, must be comfortable both a planning role and a hands-on execution-focused role. We are agile in our development process and use scrum-based methods. What we offer We offer a fantastic opportunity to join a young growth company, where you truly have the ability to make an impact and help shape the future in an exciting field. A very interesting position where you never know what the day will bring! Variability and responsibility are quite essential working conditions. Mobile health technology is a booming market worldwide, and you will be at the center of this technology revolution. Mental health is as a significant burden for society needing new solutions and ways of supporting treatment, and you will contribute to help reduce this society burden. You should expect an informal, fast-paced environment with tremendous opportunities of growth for the right candidate. Desired Skills and Expertise We expect the successful candidate to: Hold a BA or MSc within computer science or software engineering Have extensive programming experience including solution design and quality assurance Be able to grasp complex issues and find the best solution Experience with software architecture and design of software distributed / internet-based systems Have a structured and professional approach, and can stay organized – even when under pressure Have knowledge and experience of Scrum-based agile development Have knowledge and experience in QA technologies and methodologies A strategic overview of challenges and constraints as well as emerging technologies and opportunities in IT architecture and infrastructure Fluent in English Moreover, as a person we are looking for: A person able to work independently with a positive attitude who takes a constructive approach to tasks A team player, who can function in a small team of software developers A proactive and structured person who plans ahead A confident person who can multi-task and work under pressure If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact CPO Mads Frost at +45 4074 2473. Send your CV in English to jobs@monsenso.com 11 dage siden - gem job - oprindeligt job » Ansøg nu Indeed sender din ansøgning til jobs@monsenso.com . Title: Full Stack .NET Developer
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-26 06:56:02. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Full Stack .NET Developer Planday - København WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING: Are you a developer by heart that loves taking complex business problems and converting them into simple clean code solutions? Do you want to demonstrate your skills in a rapidly growing SaaS based platform while having fun with your colleagues? Then look no further and read on. Planday is looking for a skilled backend developer with web development experience, for our Copenhagen-based superstar development team. You will join an international, skilled, cross-functional and self-driven product team that includes developers, designers and product managers. We trust that you understand how your technical solutions contribute to realizing our company vision, and that you have a passion for interacting with many different people to achieve a goal. We are looking for engineers who enjoy engaging with customers and partners directly to help them be successful, and to build the tools that helps them use our platform with ease. Design and develop fully functional applications that makes for easy integration by 3rd party clients or internal services Contribute to solutions that help scale our platform to meet the demands of our rapidly growing customer base Be part of a strong creative cross-functional product team, designing, building and testing new products, services and infrastructure Creating clean, concise, robust, maintainable code across multiple platforms Work in a dynamic team oriented environment using agile methodologies. Take part in our objective to deploy every day and learn as we go along REQUIREMENTS WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: Strong experience using C# in .NET, ASP.NET MVC & WEB API Experience writing RESTful API endpoints that accept and return JSON. Knowledge of relational database concepts like SQL, indexes and constraints, transactions, and object-relational mapping. Specific experience with MS SQL Server is a bonus. Youâve had some exposure to front-end technologies (HTML, REST, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, Ajax, JSON, React.js, Backbone.js) Familiar with version control systems (Subversion and/or Git) Familiar with Test-Driven Development (TDD) or similar techniques Experience building Enterprise SAAS products a big plus Working experience in structured development and build environments (continuous integration, automated testing, automated configuration and deployment) Curiosity towards cutting technology, web, cloud or mobile development, programming languages, frameworks, methodologies An online portfolio of projects on Github or any other place is a plus Excellent written and verbal communication skills Lastly it doesn't hurt if you can kick ass on the foosball table or can play an instrument for the friday-bar sessions when Planday'ers hangout BENEFITS WHAT WE OFFER: A key part of an exciting international growth journey Opportunities to learn and develop your skills and career through hackathons, meetups, colleagues and other places. Great colleagues and a social working environment Great location in central Copenhagen Lots of team and community events QUESTIONS?: If youâve got any, just call Bettina WÃ¦de on +45 4010 0220 who assists Planday in this process or VP of Engineering Michael Ryberg Hartmann on +45 50607632 . PLEASE NOTE: Danish work permit is required and you need to be situated in or in close proximity to Copenhagen All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Title: User Experience Designer
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Systemudvikling og programmering (234) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-26 07:09:54. Bemærk, at jobannoncen ikke længere er aktuel og firmaet derfor sandsynligvis ikke længere ønsker at modtage ansøgninger. This is an old version of the job ad, which was saved on 2016-01-26 07:09:54. Please note that this job ad has expired and that the company is probably no longer interested in receiving applications. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område User Experience Designer Planday - København Planday is a SaaS Workforce Management solution that empowers managers and employees to work smarter. All team members stay in constant contact allowing for instant shift changes, updates and insights. Planday brings down staff costs by 5%, reduces administration time by 75% and increases employee satisfaction by 20%. Planday is used by different sized companies in a variety of industries such as restaurants, hotels, retailers, call centers, fitness clubs, etc. Last year, Planday closed a $3.75 million funding round from Nordic VC Creandum, an early backer of music streaming service Spotify, amongst many other investments. Founded in 2004, Planday has grown organically for the last 10 years, remaining successful and profitable throughout this time. It has built a leading workforce management SaaS solution and is now looking to scale the company internationally. Planday aims to be the no. 1 all-in-one online scheduling system in the world and plans to double revenues in the next 12 months. What weâre looking for We are looking for a User Experience Designer to help imagine, prototype, build, and refine the experiences that define our apps (iOS & Android) and Planday Product (Web). As a member of the Planday Design team, youâll work with Product and Engineering teams to bring beauty and ease-of-use to the Planday experience. Your work is clean, modern, inspiring, and above all else, empathetic. Youâre a team player with experience working across UX, interaction, UI and motion design. Mastery of all four of these disciplines isnât necessary, but we prefer designers who can take on multiple aspects of a single project. You love sketching out ideas to break down something complex into the achievable. You love to build things with the heartbeat of latest design patterns with emerging technologies in mind. You thrive working with a group of talented designers, willing to constructively critique designs and have your designs critiqued. You must have a portfolio demonstrating examples of work regarding user experience and interaction design. This role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark. Your responsibilities: Design elegant and delightful product experiences as part of an integrated Product, Design and Engineering team. Create and modify design deliverables such as specifications, process flows, wireframes, and mock-ups. Initiate and respond to ideas for innovation/improvements based on research, analysis, and design trends. Work in a collaborative environment with developers, testers, designers and product managers. Collaborate with other designers to maintain design consistency and coherence across products and overall brand. Identify user needs and business requirements for interaction design. Build prototypes to conduct user testing internally and externally and refine solutions based on data and other findings. Lead and manage application design from start to finish. REQUIREMENTS 3+ years of direct experience in UX/Interaction Design. Experience designing and building products and features for mobile (iOS & Android) and web in responsive frameworks. Solid understanding of user experience, user research, interaction design, and design principles. Passion for identifying and solving real user problems. An ability to tell compelling stories about your designs and present your work with confidence. Solid intuition and strong passion for detailed interaction design. Ability to prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time. Proficient in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Invision, Pixate and other design and prototyping tools. BENEFITS What we offer: A key part of an exciting international growth journey Opportunities to learn and develop your skills and career through hackathons, meetups, colleagues and other places. Great colleagues and a social working environment Great location in central Copenhagen Lots of team and community events Please note: Danish work permit is required and you need to be situated in or in close proximity to Copenhagen All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Title: HCM Business Processes Senior Consultant Job
Description: Relevant details not found in the PaidJob-inner section.
HTML_Text: Lignende jobannoncer Job i Storkøbenhavn kategoriseret i Økonomi- og virksomhedssystemer (74) Jobindex Jobannoncearkiv Dette er en gammel version af jobannoncen, som blev gemt 2016-01-24 03:13:42. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område HCM Business Processes Senior Consultant Job SAP - København Requisition ID: 98821 Work Area: Sales Expected Travel: 0 - 50% Career Status: Professional Employment Type: Regular Full Time COMPANY DESCRIPTION As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably. PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES: SAP’s Service & Support strategy is driving innovative services to customers from an end-to-end perspective. Global Consulting Delivery (GCD) provides a major cornerstone in this value-chain. The mission of GCD is to achieve customer satisfaction and retention by efficient and flawless implementation of all SAP solutions across all geographies. GCD is the Trusted Partner for all customers globally. It delivers excellence by helping customers on their journey to innovation and simplification across all solutions providing an unparalleled service experience On Premise, in the Cloud as well as hybrid delivering efficient results based on major practices with a focus on Industry, LoB and Platform EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS: Demonstrate extensive functional and/or solution experience through the facilitation, implementation and support of SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) solution to enhance the clients’ business functionality and overall performance, while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction. Is considered the senior thought leader in the area of product or solution expertise and leverages their advanced skills to in consulting and problem solving to create customer value, oftentimes in high profile, strategic accounts. Continually maintain a high degree of knowledge and understanding of their area of expertise, business process and solutions, keep current with release levels, industry issues, and market trends. Responsibility for the successful implementation of SAP processes, solutions, and products within assigned accounts for their core area of expertise. Make strategic and tactical recommendations and decisions for customers/externally regularly and will advise management internally on a regular basis. EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES: Required skills Functional University degree in computer science, human resources or comparable education or job experience Maintaining and expanding client relationships through delivery of solution based high quality work Excellent oral and written communication skills Excellent English language skills, oral and written Leading, coaching and developing best practices within the organization Managing client assignments, technical/functional content, and overall customer satisfaction Maintaining a close relationship with the customer to initiate new software sales Experience in Web Technologies as well as their application in the Human Capital Management Implementation experience in the area of SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) solution Maintaining and expanding client relationships through delivery of solution based high quality work Experience with managing the Quality Assurance processes for software implementations Experience in HR practices, as well as SAP, PeopleSoft, Lawson, Oracle or other HR software preferred Experience working in a large, complex global team environment Technical Experiences with Agile development methodologies Solid experience working in a cross-functional development team Knowledge of HTTP b, HTML and XML is required WORK EXPERIENCE: Minimum 7 years of professional experience w/ a minimum of 3 years full life cycle software implementation proejcts. # consultingcareersHCM Extensive HCM domain knowledge SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: careers@sap.com ). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Søg efter job Arbejdsgivere / Opsæt job Upload dit CV log på Hvad: Hvor: Avanceret jobsøgning Jobtitel, søgeord eller virksomhed by eller område Partner Support Specialist - Flexible Hours, Copenhagen Uber - København Uber Overview Uber is a Series E venture-funded startup headquartered in San Francisco, California. We are a global mobility and logistics technology platform: our flagship service allows users to request quality, on-demand rides with a touch of their smartphone but we are rapidly developing new products. We are present in over 320+ cities worldwide, including over 70+ cities in EMEA with plans to rapidly expand in the region. Our technology allows us to move the physical world: We believe that, through innovation and entrepreneurship, we can have a meaningful impact on cities around the world Job Description Uber is looking for brand new Partner Support Representatives to help build our Partner Support Centre (PSC) in Copenhagen! WHO YOU ARE We are looking to build a team of rock stars for our support centre in Copenhagen. We need people with strong communication and problem-solving skills, who don’t shy away from in-person interactions. Aside from helping partner drivers, our support centre is also used to educate and teach our partner drivers how to best use our app. You’ll be expected to help review documents, provide exceptional support, and quickly adapt in an ever-growing business. This is a great opportunity to work with a top-notch Operations team and deep dive into our day-to-day-operations. This is a contract/part-time role with the potential for extension. WHAT YOU’LL DO Deliver 5-star, on-brand, in-person support for our partner drivers Walk partner drivers through our app and how to use all the tools to use our app in the most efficient way possible Upload and approve documentation Stay on top of processes and tools Work with the Operations team to streamline procedure Help maintain organisation of the Partner Support Centre (PSC) WHEN & WHERE YOU’LL DO IT Up to 5 days per week, 15-25 hours a week (schedule may change based on business needs; we need someone who’s flexible) Copenhagen (Østerbro) WHY YOU’LL SUCCEED You have retail and/or customer experience You are an effective communicator with the ability to interact with customers You are personable, highly organised, and a patient teacher You have a passion for helping and empowering others You can quickly and efficiently troubleshoot problems If you don’t know the answer, you know where to look and who to ask You are a tech savvy You are self-motivated and a great team player **Familiarity with Zen-desk is a plus! 1 dag siden - gem job » Vis eller anvend på job Anbefalede job Reservedelsekspedient HumanizeR ApS - Gladsaxe Jobnet.dk - 10 dage siden Serviceteknikere Sharp Business Systems Danmark A/S - Albertslund IT-Jobbank - 14 dage siden Lagerassistent, fuldtid Silvan - Tårnby Silvan - 14 dage siden Psykiatrisk Center København søger 1 overlæge...
